question.body: In addition to the reduced stomach size, what other function does removing part of the small intestine have?

multiple_choice.choice: reduced mixing with digestive fluids and nutrient adsorption
altered water adsorption and reduced bloating
removal of nerves that trigger hunger

response.feedback: Correct. With less nutrient adsorption fewer carbohydrates and fats enter the body.
Incorrect. Water is absorbed primarily in the large intestine.
Incorrect. The hormones and sensory nerves associated with eating are primarily in the stomach.
Incorrect. Native bacteria are found in the large intestine.

part.hint: Consider the function of the duodenum.
